content: stitches keep your hook parallel to your work not on an angle as you pull up the loops to the same height you can make your puff stitches with more or less yarn overs i like to do 4 for this pattern with the yarns i chose 100% cotton or bamboo yarns in my opinion will not give the desired result for this design yarns with more loft air in them are better for this design cotton is also more a difþcult yarn to make neat puff stitches with if possible choose a yarn with a bit of stretch to make the puff stitches easier abbreviations us terms chain - chain chain-2sp - chain 2 or any number space double_crochet - double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet half_double_crochet - half treble_crochet pm - place stitch marker in stitch just made single_crochet - single_crochet slip st - slip_stitch st s - stitch es treble_crochet - treble_crochet - instructions inside these brackets are made into the same stitch or space and repeated as directed - stitch counts are given inside these brackets puff flower easter egg us 4 crochet road special stitches use regular puff stitches if you prefer them to this puff variation puff variation - yarn over insert hook into magic_ring draw up a loop to 2cm/ 8in height yarn over insert hook into magic_ring draw up a loop to 2cm/ 8in height 4 times there will be 9 loops on hook pinch & hold the strand of yarn at the left hand side base of the stitch yarn over and pull through all 9 loops insert hook into space youõre holding open just to the left of your stitch draw up a loop yarn over and tightly pull through remaining 2 loops on hook see video for full tutorial for a clear step by step of how to do these if you need it fasten_off - cut yarn with about a 15cm/6in tail unless otherwise instructed pull up on crochet hook to pull yarn tail through the loop on your hook half_double_crochet half treble_crochet - yarn over twice insert hook into indicated stitch or space draw up a loop yarn over draw through two loops yarn over draw through remaining three loops on hook this stitch is a little taller than a double_crochet and a little shorter than a treble_crochet invisible join - thread yarn tail onto a tapestry needle place needle from front to back through both front and back loops of 2nd stitch of the round now insert needle into the last stitch of the round and pull through gently now insert needle through front and back loops of þrst stitch of round and pull through gently this makes the join invisible and þnishes your round off neatly weave the end in and trim end close to your work see video for full tutorial for a clear step by step of how to do these if you need it invisible / slip_stitch joins -
